name: SpottedFeverRickettsiosisTestsForRickettsiaSpottedFeverGroupAntigenInTissueByImmuneStaining
title: Spotted Fever Rickettsiosis (Tests for Rickettsia Spotted Fever Group Antigen in Tissue by Immune Staining)
description: The Spotted fever group - SPG contains bacteria recognized as human pathogens: R. rickettsii, R. conorii, R. africae, R. sibirica, R. japonica, R. honei, R. parkeri, R. massiliae, R. monacensis, R. slovaca, R. aeschlimannii, and R. helvetica. R. rickettsia and R. parkeri are endemic to North America. Transitional group: R. australis, R. akari, R. felis (MCM).
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: This set of values contains codes for laboratory test names associated with detecting the presence of Rickettsia rickettsii and Other Other Spotted Fever Group Rickettsia antigen in tissue by immune staining.),(Data Element Scope: Laboratory tests names that were ordered or observed.),(Inclusion Criteria: component: Rickettsia antigen;  
Specimen = tissue),(Exclusion Criteria: Rickettsia sp, some SFG organisms (Rickettsia japonica, Rickettsia hoogstraalii); Rickettsia Typhus group)

Rickettsia rickettsii Ag [Identifier] in Tissue by Immunofluorescence
